items.title: Trump Renews Attacks on Obamacare in New Push Over Government Shutdown
items.summary: The president claimed that the Affordable Care Act benefited insurance companies over people, saying he would work with both parties on the issue “once the Government is open.”

items.title: Where Democrats Will Duel Next for the Party’s Future
items.summary: In Michigan, Maine and many other states, primary candidates will decide the party’s direction on a host of policy issues, and ultimately whether it has a center-left or left-wing vision.

items.title: Trump Loyalists Push ‘Grand Conspiracy’ as New Subpoenas Land
items.summary: The Justice Department moved an inquiry that appeared initially focused on the former C.I.A. director John O. Brennan to South Florida and is beginning to recruit line prosecutors.

items.title: A Two-Headed Coin That Always Comes Up ‘Trump’
items.summary: Would a proposed coin featuring the president on both sides commemorate America’s founding, or undercut its founding principles?

items.title: The Celebrated Chef Who Robbed Banks
items.summary: Valentino Luchin, 62, once owned an acclaimed Italian restaurant. Now he sits in a Bay Area jail.

items.title: New SF Clinic Helps People Facing Health Breakdowns in Public
items.summary: A former Goodwill thrift store now houses an urgent care clinic for people experiencing mental health breakdowns in public.

items.title: Ghislaine Maxwell reportedly ‘much happier’ after prison transfer by Trump officials
items.summary: <p>Jeffrey Epstein associate, serving 20 years for sex-trafficking crimes, is now in minimum-security federal prison in Texas</p><p>Longtime <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/jeffrey-epstein">Jeffrey Epstein</a> associate <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/ghislaine-maxwell">Ghislaine Maxwell</a>, who is serving a 20-year prison sentence for <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2021/dec/29/ghislaine-maxwell-sex-trafficking-trial-verdict">sex-trafficking crimes</a>, has reportedly said that she is “much, much happier” after the Trump administration transferred her to a minimum-security federal prison in Texas, according to emails obtained by <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/ghislaine-maxwell-prison-emails-minimum-security-bryan-texas-rcna242218">NBC News</a>.</p><p>Maxwell, 63, was <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/aug/01/ghislaine-maxwell-prison-transfer">moved</a> from a low-security prison in Tallahassee, Florida, to the minimum-security Federal Prison Camp Bryan in Texas in August –&nbsp;just days after she was <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/jul/25/ghislaine-maxwell-justice-department-meeting">interviewed</a> about the Epstein case by deputy attorney general, Todd Blanche. Blanche is a former personal lawyer for <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a>, who had been friends with the late Epstein – a convicted sex offender – before winning two presidencies.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/09/ghislaine-maxwell-trump-admin-prison-transfer">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: They flew to New York to help Mamdani – now they want to bring the hope to LA
items.summary: <p>Activists in Los Angeles say the energy from the Hollywood strikes has been reignited by the success of the mayor-elect</p><p>While the excitement for mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani has radiated through New York, his win has also energized young activists across the country – particularly some in Los Angeles, who flew to the east coast to canvass for Mamdani and now want to bring their experiences westward.</p><p>Standing near the poll site at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Neda Davarpanah – a screenwriter and actor based in Los Angeles – was inspired by Mamdani’s campaign for mayor so she flew out to New York in late October to canvass on the Upper East Side.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/nov/09/new-york-zohran-mamdani-los-angeles">Continue reading...</a>
